headline: Friday challenge #1: Science workplaces
text: @guardiansciblog Here's where I reduce secret and naked (i.e. unprocessed) Planck data #FridayChallenge twitter.com/Dr_Whatson/sta  Bob Watson (@Dr_Whatson) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog My office in the Centre for Quantum Information and Foundations, University of Cambridge. twitter.com/jmyearsley/sta  James Yearsley (@jmyearsley) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog Scoring sleep lab records...so much fun! #FridayChallenge twitpic.com/bdp4ru  Jordan Gaines (@GainesOnBrains) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog Near-naked sheep looks on as I calculate number of missing galaxies in my catalogue #FridayChallenge twitter.com/allinthegutter  weareallinthegutter (@allinthegutter) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog My office doubles as my kitchen. Doing my Masters on planetary nebulae :) twitter.com/Amy_Squeales/s  Amy Seales (@Amy_Squeales) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog #FridayChallenge Deep behindthescenes of the UMZC, where I study ancient mammal anatomy & grow beards. twitter.com/LSmonster/stat  Nick Crumpton (@LSmonster) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog I'm a computational chemist working on new antibiotics - the model is of an antibiotic peptide twitter.com/WeasellePie/st  Elles Belles (@WeasellePie) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog #FridayChallenge All over the place today yfrog.com/o06x8jaj & yfrog.com/esa63kjj & yfrog.com/nxqhtnwj  Dave Briggs (@xtaldave) November 16, 2012      @guardiansciblog NH gallery @hornimanmuseum: I'm co-ordinating a "Bioblitz style" collection review (@hornimanreviews) twitter.com/RussellDornan/  Russell Dornan (@RussellDornan) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog here's my desk - ah, the glamorous life of a statistician twitter.com/BobOHara/statu  Bob O'Hara (@BobOHara) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog my computer simulating galaxies and the observatory of Strasbourg through my window #FridayChallenge twitter.com/domaubr/status  Dominique Aubert (@domaubr) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog two public health researchers marking student essays at out kitchen table http://twitter.yfrog.com/odqb1mpj  Jean Adams (@jeanmadams) November 16, 2012      @guardiansciblog being a Sports Scientist for British Tennis has its ups during Wimbledon! twitter.com/HarveyGalvin/s  Harvey Galvin (@HarveyGalvin) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog Here's us at the University of Arkansas syncing up our new olfactometer with EEG. twitter.com/crluckett/stat  Curtis Luckett (@crluckett) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog I get to work in a motion capture lab - these aren't light bulbs, just super-reflective markers. Fun! twitter.com/DrPeteEtchells  Pete Etchells (@DrPeteEtchells) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog my station in the fly room! drosophila ovary dissection just about to begin... twitter.com/sciencewhat/st  sophie liddell (@sciencewhat) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog This is the new Square Kilometre Array telescope HQ next to the Lovell telescope at Jodrell Bank twitter.com/SKA_telescope/  SquareKilometreArray (@SKA_telescope) November 16, 2012   @guardianscience @guardiansciblog dinner time for snails, vectors of human schistosomiasis NHM biomedical research twitter.com/SciAnouk/statu  Anouk Gouvras (@SciAnouk) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog #FridayChallenge We heart #pharmacology here at the British Pharmacological Society office! twitter.com/PharmacologyNo  PharmacologyNow (@PharmacologyNow) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog I'm a geographer interested in wildfire emissions, a typical "day in the office" might look like this! twitter.com/_tels/status/2  Thomas Smith (@_tels) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog The Second Year students on the Civil/Environmental Engineering degree at UCL making... something... twitter.com/CEGE_UCL/statu  CEGE UCL (@CEGE_UCL) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog #FridayChallenge. The beginnings of a phd in wheat physiology showing open wheat stomata on screen twitter.com/AmeliaFrizell/  Amelia(@AmeliaFrizell) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog #FridayChallenge "Hello.....?": Friday at 5 o'clock in the Psychology postgrad office twitter.com/MaynoothNeuro/  MaynoothNeuroLab (@MaynoothNeuro) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog I'm a chemistry technician & the biologists plonked this handsome little fellow on my desk... twitter.com/mikkaila/statu  Mikkaila (@mikkaila) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog Cool! This is both my workplace & an historic science spacermg.co.uk/upload/img/D55 @rmathematicus  Rebekah Higgitt (@beckyfh) November 16, 2012   @guardiansciblog#FridayChallenge: For balance & baseline here's an "Ex-Scientist turned craftsperson's" workshop :D twitter.com/Rohypgnosis/st  Rohypgnosis (@Rohypgnosis) November 17, 2012   @guardiansciblog Office for next 4 weeks, investigating impact of climate change on Antarctic penguins #FridayChallenge twitter.com/Ben_Collen/sta  Ben (@Ben_Collen) November 18, 2012   @guardianscience @guardiansciblog a lunch break rest! Whilst out tree seedling surveying!!! twitter.com/WilliamBodles/ william bodles (@WilliamBodles) November 18, 2012  You can follow Guardian Science Blogs on Twitter @guardiansciblog, and the hashtag for our Friday Challenges is #FridayChallenge.
